performance_progress: Liam is an enthusiastic and highly verbal student who shows advanced abilities in math reasoning and problem-solving. He struggles with impulsivity, calling out, and sustaining attention for non-preferred tasks. Written output is brief and rushed without support.

education_goals.academic: By June 2026, Liam will complete assigned math and language arts tasks with at least 80% accuracy while using agreed self-monitoring strategies in 4 out of 5 days.
education_goals.social: Liam will wait his turn to speak and raise his hand in whole-class discussions in 4 out of 5 observed opportunities.
education_goals.behavioural: Liam will use a cue (visual or non-verbal) from the teacher to redirect his focus within 1 minute in 4 out of 5 instances.
education_goals.communicative: Liam will explain problem-solving steps using math vocabulary in both oral and written formats with teacher support.
education_goals.physical: No significant physical needs; benefits from movement and flexible seating.

accommodations.instructional:
Provide clear, time-limited tasks.
Offer challenge/extension problems for enrichment.
Use graphic organizers to support planning before writing.
accommodations.environmental:
Flexible seating options (wobble stool, standing desk).
Preferential seating close to teacher for prompts.
accommodations.assessment:
Shortened written tasks where appropriate.
Allow oral responses or scribe for longer assessments.
Extra time as needed.
accommodations.technology:
Access to laptop for typing longer responses.
Use of timers and organizational tools.

assessments: Teacher reports and attention checklist (2024-2025) indicate significant inattention and impulsivity impacting work completion; academic scores above grade level in math, at grade level in reading.
transition_goals:
Short-term: increase Liam's independence using checklists and timers.
Long-term: support executive functioning skills for upper elementary and beyond.
